Originally, a small quaker town in the early 1600's, Wayne has become a bustling community in the heart of the Main Line. Started as a rural farming community, over time affluent families moved to the area.
Everything in Wayne is accessible by only a short walk. A car is not a necessity to see and do things here. If needed public buses, and the Septa train station are only a short distance away.

Wayne is filled with quaint and unique shops. New stores are always popping up. From trendy baby stores, to sophisticated shopping, there is something for everyone. A few popular stores are Genes, Wayne Sporting Goods, South Moon Under, Anthropologie, The Pink Turtle and Wayne Jewelers.

No matter what your taste, there is a place for everyone to eat here. Local favorites are Christopher's, The Great American Pub, and Minellas Diner. And in case you have  a sweet tooth, there are plenty bakeries in the area such as Aux Petites Delices and Great Harvest Bread.
For lodging purposes, the Wayne Hotel, the Courtyard Marriot and the Valley Forge Suites.
